summary:
FY25 Q4 Performance Report – Material Information Summary

Strategic & Operational Highlights

  • Huntly BESS (100MW/2hr) construction commenced – On track with site enablement works underway.
  • Non-binding term sheet signed to maintain Huntly Rankine units until ~2035, supported by Huntly Firming Options (HFOs) and a jointly funded coal reserve.
  • Customer Flex Initiatives:
  • Hot water trial shifted 1.43 GWh of demand (17,000 households).
  • Ecobulb program distributed 260,000 units, reducing peak demand by 13.5 MW.
  • Gas Deal with Methanex: Short-term flexible agreement delivered 33 TJ, minimizing thermal generation during low-price periods.
  • Thermal Generation Flexibility: Demonstrated ±200 MW swing capability.
  • Hydro Reliability: Rangipo G5 (60MW) returned from overhaul; full hydro availability for winter.

Financial & Volume Metrics

  • Electricity Netback: $170/MWh (↓21.1% YoY).
  • Retail Sales: 1,696 GWh (↑160 GWh YoY); 520,519 customers (↑4.8% YoY).
  • Kupe Oil Production: 34 kbbl (↑12.9% YoY).
  • Operational Coal Stockpile: 578 kt (↑370 kt YoY).

No material capital-raising or timetable details identified.

Focus areas: Energy security (Rankine extension, coal reserve), flexible generation (BESS, gas deal), and demand management (Ecobulb, hot water trial).

• Acquisition Announcement: Sky NZ to acquire 100% of Discovery NZ for $1 (cash-free, debt-free), expected completion 1 August 2025.
  • Revenue Impact: Expected annual revenue uplift of ~$95m (~25% from digital).
  • Strategic Benefits:
  • Adds ThreeNow BVOD platform and free-to-air channel Three, expanding digital/linear reach.
  • Combined advertising revenue share: ~35% linear TV, ~24% digital TV.
  • Targets $10m sustainable EBITDA growth from FY28.
  • Financials:
  • Positive free cash flow from FY26; FY26 dividend target of 30cps unchanged.
  • Integration costs: $6.5m net (with WBD contribution).
  • Synergies: Primarily in content and broadcasting infrastructure.
  • Audience: Expands weekly reach to 2.2m linear and 1.2m digital viewers.
  • Regulatory: Commerce Commission not reviewing the acquisition.

No material information omitted.
